industries.name: Medical Offices
industries.heroSubtitle: We protect your accreditation with JCAHO-compliant cleaning and documentation. From waiting rooms to sterile fields.

benefits.title: JCAHO Compliant
benefits.description: Our FSMs ensure your facility logs and standards meet JCAHO & OSHA requirements.

benefits.title: Nightly Audits
benefits.description: Our Night Manager physically verifies terminal cleaning protocols every night.

benefits.title: One Invoice
benefits.description: Consolidate cleaning, biohazard, and supplies into one tracked monthly bill.

faqs.question: How do you handle audit documentation?
faqs.answer: We maintain digital logs of every service, chemical used, and inspection performed, readily available for your JCAHO or state inspections.

faqs.question: Do you handle biohazard waste?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our partnered waste management contractors are fully certified to handle red-bag waste in compliance with OSHA and local regulations.

faqs.question: How do you ensure quality?
faqs.answer: Unlike other companies that set it and forget it, we employ Night Managers who physically audit our contractors' work to ensuring consistent quality.

industries.name: Urgent Care Centers
industries.heroSubtitle: Keep your waiting rooms empty and your exam rooms sterile with rapid-turnover cleaning.

benefits.title: Rapid Response
benefits.description: Our FSMs are on call 24/7 to handle spills and biohazards immediately.

benefits.title: Infection Control
benefits.description: Hospital-grade disinfectants to prevent cross-contamination in high-traffic areas.

benefits.title: One Invoice
benefits.description: Simplify your AP process with a single invoice for all facility services.

faqs.question: Can you handle high-traffic waiting rooms?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Our contractors specialize in high-turnover environments, using hospital-grade disinfectants to keep waiting areas safe for patients.

faqs.question: What about flu season demands?
faqs.answer: We scale our porter services during peak seasons to ensure your facility remains sanitary despite increased patient volume.

industries.name: Surgery Centers
industries.heroSubtitle: Terminal cleaning and sterile protocols designed for AAAHC and CMS compliance.

benefits.title: Audit Ready
benefits.description: We guarantee your facility is ready for AAAHC/CMS unannounced surveys.

benefits.title: Terminal Cleaning
benefits.description: AORN-standard cleaning verified nightly by our clinical auditors.

benefits.title: One Invoice
benefits.description: Streamline your overhead with a single consolidated facility invoice.

faqs.question: Are your contractors certified for OR cleaning?
faqs.answer: Yes. We only deploy contractors with specific training in AORN standards and terminal cleaning protocols for operating rooms.

faqs.question: How do you verify high-level disinfection?
faqs.answer: Our Night Managers verify that vendors followed CDC Guidelines for Healthcare Facilities and OSHA's Bloodborne Pathogen Standard (29 CFR 1910.1030) using ATP testing, visual inspections, and protocol checklists ‚Äî every night, with digital proof by morning.

industries.name: Auto Dealerships
industries.heroSubtitle: Boost your CSI scores with a spotless showroom. We handle the cleaning so you can sell cars.

benefits.title: Boost CSI Scores
benefits.description: A cleaner facility leads to happier customers and better survey scores.

benefits.title: Showroom Shine
benefits.description: High-gloss floor care to make your inventory pop under the lights.

benefits.title: One Invoice

faqs.question: Do you clean shop floors?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our contractors use industrial scrubbers to remove grease and oil from service bay floors, keeping your shop safe and professional.

faqs.question: Can you handle late night showroom cleaning?
faqs.answer: Yes. We work around your sales hours, typically overnight, to ensure you open to a pristine showroom every morning.

industries.name: Daycares & Preschools
industries.heroTitle: The Safest Standard for Childcare Facilities

benefits.title: Viral Prevention
benefits.description: Proactive disinfecting protocols to stop the spread of colds and flu.

benefits.title: Non-Toxic Safety
benefits.description: We strictly enforce the use of Green Seal certified, child-safe products.

benefits.title: Background Checked
benefits.description: Every single contractor is vetted for safety in child-focused environments.

faqs.question: Are your cleaning products safe for kids?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We strictly require our contractors to use Green Seal certified, non-toxic products that are safe for children and pets.

faqs.question: How do you handle flu outbreaks?
faqs.answer: We have specific viral prevention protocols (electrostatic spraying) ready to deploy immediately upon notification of an illness.

services.name: Medical Office Cleaning
services.shortDescription: Specialized cleaning for healthcare facilities focused on infection control and regulatory compliance.
services.longDescription: Medical offices face unique cleaning demands that generic janitorial services can't meet. From bloodborne pathogen protocols to JCAHO-compliant documentation, every surface in your practice carries compliance weight. Our contractors are specifically trained in healthcare cleaning standards ‚Äî using hospital-grade EPA-registered disinfectants, following CDC guidelines for environmental infection control, and maintaining the detailed logs your accreditation surveys demand.

features.title: Terminal Cleaning
features.description: End-of-day deep disinfection of exam rooms, procedure areas, and high-touch surfaces following CDC guidelines for healthcare facilities.

features.title: Compliance Documentation
features.description: Digital logs of every cleaning session, chemicals used, and protocols followed ‚Äî ready for JCAHO, OSHA, or state health department audits.

features.title: Biohazard Safety
features.description: Contractors trained in OSHA's Bloodborne Pathogen Standard (29 CFR 1910.1030) for safe handling of sharps containers, red-bag waste, and contaminated surfaces.

features.title: Nightly Verification
features.description: Our Night Managers physically inspect your facility after every clean, submitting a photographic audit report before morning.

faqs.question: What certifications do your medical cleaning contractors have?
faqs.answer: All contractors deployed to medical facilities are trained in OSHA's Bloodborne Pathogen Standard, HIPAA environmental compliance, and infection control best practices. We verify credentials before any contractor steps foot in your practice.

faqs.question: How do you handle cleaning around sensitive medical equipment?
faqs.answer: Our cleaning protocols account for equipment sensitivity. Contractors use approved non-corrosive disinfectants near electronics and never disturb calibrated instruments. We work with your office manager to create a custom scope for every room.

faqs.question: Can you provide documentation for our JCAHO survey?
faqs.answer: Yes. We maintain digital logs with timestamps, chemical SDS sheets, and Night Manager audit photos. Your FSM can generate a compliance report on demand for any survey or inspection.

services.name: Urgent Care Cleaning
services.shortDescription: Rapid response cleaning for high-traffic urgent care centers that operate extended hours.
services.longDescription: Urgent care centers see 300+ patients per week in environments where every surface is a potential vector. Unlike standard offices, your facility needs same-day spill response, high-frequency touchpoint disinfection, and cleaning crews that can work around walk-in patient flow. We match you with contractors experienced in high-velocity healthcare environments and verify every clean through our Night Manager audit system.

features.title: High-Traffic Disinfection
features.description: Hourly touchpoint wipe-downs during peak seasons and end-of-day full-room disinfection using EPA-registered hospital-grade products.

features.title: Same-Day Spill Response
features.description: Biohazard spill cleanup within your operating hours ‚Äî our on-call contractors respond within 60 minutes for bodily fluid incidents.

features.title: Extended-Hour Scheduling
features.description: Flexible cleaning windows that work around 7am‚Äì9pm urgent care schedules, including split-shift and overnight options.

features.title: Seasonal Surge Support
features.description: Automatic scaling of porter and disinfecting services during flu season, RSV outbreaks, and other high-demand periods.

faqs.question: Can you clean while patients are still being seen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our day porter services handle waiting room maintenance, restroom restocking, and touchpoint disinfection during operating hours without disrupting patient flow. Deep cleaning happens after close.

faqs.question: How quickly can you respond to a biohazard spill?
faqs.answer: Our on-call contractors respond within 60 minutes for biohazard incidents during your operating hours. After hours, your nightly crew handles it as part of their standard terminal cleaning protocol.

faqs.question: Do you scale up during flu season?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We proactively increase disinfection frequency and add electrostatic spraying services from October through March. Your FSM coordinates this automatically ‚Äî no extra legwork on your end.

services.name: Surgery Center Cleaning
services.shortDescription: Sterile audit-ready cleaning for ambulatory surgery centers meeting AAAHC and CMS standards.
services.longDescription: Ambulatory surgery centers face the highest cleaning standards in healthcare ‚Äî one missed surface can trigger a CMS citation or compromise a patient. Our terminal cleaning protocols follow AORN guidelines: every OR is stripped, disinfected, and verified by a Night Manager using ATP testing before morning. We maintain the documentation chain your AAAHC or state survey demands, so you can focus on care instead of compliance paperwork.

features.title: AORN Terminal Cleaning
features.description: Operating room turnover and end-of-day terminal cleaning following Association of periOperative Registered Nurses standards for sterile environments.

features.title: ATP Verification
features.description: Adenosine triphosphate testing on critical surfaces to provide measurable proof of disinfection ‚Äî not just visual cleanliness.

features.title: CMS Survey Documentation
features.description: Complete digital audit trail including cleaning timestamps, chemical logs, and Night Manager inspection photos ready for unannounced CMS surveys.

features.title: Sterile Supply Coordination
features.description: We coordinate with your materials management team to ensure proper waste segregation, linen handling, and sterile supply storage protocols.

faqs.question: Are your contractors certified for operating room cleaning?
faqs.answer: Yes. We only deploy contractors with specific training in AORN standards, proper PPE usage, and terminal cleaning protocols for perioperative environments. Certification is verified before assignment.

faqs.question: How do you handle unannounced CMS surveys?
faqs.answer: Because our Night Managers verify every clean nightly with photographic documentation and ATP testing, your facility is always survey-ready. We maintain 12 months of digital cleaning records accessible within minutes.

faqs.question: Can you coordinate cleaning around our surgical schedule?
faqs.answer: Yes. Your FSM works with your OR coordinator to build a cleaning schedule that accounts for case end-times, turnover requirements, and overnight terminal cleaning windows.

services.name: Daycare Cleaning
services.shortDescription: Safe, non-toxic cleaning for childcare environments using Green Seal certified products.
services.longDescription: Children touch everything ‚Äî and put most of it in their mouths. Daycare and preschool cleaning requires a fundamentally different approach than standard commercial cleaning. Every product must be non-toxic and Green Seal certified, every toy and surface must be sanitized to prevent illness outbreaks, and every contractor must pass enhanced background screening. We build these safeguards into your scope so parents see a facility they can trust.

features.title: Non-Toxic Product Standard
features.description: We strictly enforce Green Seal and EPA Safer Choice certified products ‚Äî zero harsh chemicals in classrooms, play areas, or napping rooms.

features.title: Toy & Surface Sanitization
features.description: Nightly sanitization of shared toys, play mats, cribs, and high-touch surfaces using child-safe quaternary disinfectants.

features.title: Outbreak Response
features.description: Electrostatic spraying deployed within 24 hours of an illness notification to prevent the spread of hand-foot-mouth, RSV, or flu through your facility.

features.title: Enhanced Background Screening
features.description: Every contractor assigned to your daycare undergoes expanded background checks beyond standard requirements, appropriate for child-focused environments.

faqs.question: Are all your cleaning products safe for infants and toddlers?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We require Green Seal or EPA Safer Choice certified products exclusively in childcare facilities. No bleach fumes, no harsh residues ‚Äî just effective, child-safe cleaning.

faqs.question: How do you handle a lice or illness outbreak?
faqs.answer: We have specific outbreak protocols including targeted electrostatic disinfection, enhanced toy sanitization, and increased cleaning frequency. Your FSM coordinates the response within 24 hours of notification.

faqs.question: Do your contractors undergo background checks for childcare facilities?
faqs.answer: Yes. Every contractor deployed to daycares and preschools undergoes enhanced background screening including sex offender registry checks, beyond our standard vetting process.

services.name: Floor Care
services.shortDescription: Professional hard floor maintenance including stripping, waxing, buffing, and tile restoration.
services.longDescription: Your floors are the first thing visitors notice and the last thing most cleaning companies prioritize. Neglected VCT, tile, and hardwood floors become slip hazards, look unprofessional, and cost thousands to replace prematurely. Our floor care specialists extend the life of your flooring investment through scheduled strip-and-wax cycles, high-speed burnishing, tile and grout restoration, and concrete sealing ‚Äî all coordinated through your FSM so you never have to think about it.

features.title: Strip & Wax Cycles
features.description: Scheduled removal of old wax buildup and application of fresh high-gloss finish coats to restore VCT and vinyl floors to showroom condition.

features.title: Tile & Grout Restoration
features.description: Deep steam cleaning and grout sealing to eliminate discoloration, mold, and bacteria hiding in porous grout lines.

features.title: High-Speed Burnishing
features.description: Ultra-high-speed buffing to maintain a wet-look shine between strip-and-wax cycles, keeping your floors presentation-ready year-round.

features.title: Concrete & Epoxy Sealing
features.description: Protective coatings for warehouse floors, service bays, and utility areas to prevent staining, dusting, and moisture damage.

faqs.question: How often should commercial floors be stripped and waxed?
faqs.answer: It depends on foot traffic. Medical offices typically need quarterly strip-and-wax with monthly burnishing in between. High-traffic lobbies may need it monthly. Your FSM builds a schedule based on your facility's actual wear patterns.

faqs.question: Can you work on floors overnight without disrupting our business?
faqs.answer: Yes. All floor care work is scheduled after hours. Our crews section off areas systematically so the floor is dry and walkable before your first employee arrives.

faqs.question: Do you handle both hard floors and carpeted areas?
faqs.answer: Yes. We coordinate hard floor care and carpet cleaning under one scope. See our Carpet & Upholstery service for deep extraction cleaning of carpeted areas.

services.name: Carpet & Upholstery
services.shortDescription: Deep cleaning extraction to remove stains, allergens, and odors from commercial carpets and upholstered furniture.
services.longDescription: Carpets and upholstered furniture in commercial facilities silently accumulate allergens, bacteria, and stains that daily vacuuming can't reach. Over time, this degrades indoor air quality, creates odors, and shortens the life of your flooring investment. Professional hot-water extraction and encapsulation cleaning removes embedded contaminants at the fiber level ‚Äî extending carpet life by up to 50%, improving air quality scores, and restoring the professional appearance your clients and patients expect.

features.title: Hot Water Extraction
features.description: Truck-mounted steam cleaning penetrates deep into carpet fibers, dissolving embedded dirt, grease, and bacteria that vacuuming leaves behind.

features.title: Stain & Spot Treatment
features.description: Pre-treatment of high-traffic zones, coffee spills, and stubborn stains using commercial-grade spotting agents before the main extraction.

features.title: Upholstery Restoration
features.description: Waiting room chairs, lobby couches, and reception furniture cleaned with fabric-safe solutions that eliminate odors and restore appearance.

features.title: Allergen & Odor Control
features.description: HEPA-grade filtration combined with antimicrobial treatments to neutralize pet dander, dust mites, mold spores, and trapped odors.

faqs.question: How often should commercial carpets be professionally cleaned?
faqs.answer: For medical and high-traffic facilities, we recommend quarterly deep extraction. Offices with moderate traffic benefit from semi-annual cleaning. Our FSMs assess your space and build a schedule that balances cost and cleanliness.

faqs.question: Will the cleaning disrupt our business hours?
faqs.answer: No. Our contractors perform all carpet and upholstery work after hours or on weekends. Drying time is typically 4‚Äì6 hours, so your facility is ready before the next business day.

faqs.question: Is hot water extraction safe for all carpet types?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our contractors are trained on manufacturer specifications for every carpet type ‚Äî from commercial loop pile to medical-grade sealed-back carpet tile. We adjust water temperature, pressure, and chemistry accordingly.

services.name: Commercial Cleaning
services.shortDescription: Consistent, customized nightly cleaning tailored to your facility type and business hours.
services.longDescription: Every facility is different ‚Äî a medical waiting room has different needs than a car dealership showroom. Generic cleaning packages miss the details that matter. We build a custom scope for your specific facility, deploy trained crews who learn your space, and verify quality through nightly Night Manager audits. The result: consistently clean, zero surprises, one invoice.

features.title: Custom Cleaning Scopes
features.description: Your FSM walks your facility room by room, documenting specific needs ‚Äî from restroom frequency to trash liner types ‚Äî before work begins.

features.title: Dedicated Crew Assignment
features.description: The same trained crew services your facility every night, learning your space and building consistency that rotating teams can't match.

features.title: Quality Verification
features.description: Night Managers physically audit every clean using a standardized checklist and submit photographic documentation before morning.

features.title: After-Hours Scheduling
features.description: All cleaning happens outside your business hours ‚Äî overnight, early morning, or weekends ‚Äî so your team never sees a mop bucket.

faqs.question: How do you handle security and keys for after-hours access?
faqs.answer: We work with your property management to establish secure key protocols, alarm procedures, and check-in/check-out logs. Every contractor is background-checked and bonded.

faqs.question: What happens if a cleaning issue is missed?
faqs.answer: Our Night Managers catch issues before you arrive. If something is missed, your FSM is notified immediately and dispatches a crew for same-day resolution ‚Äî no extra charge.

faqs.question: Can we adjust the scope as our needs change?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Your FSM does quarterly scope reviews and adjusts frequency, tasks, and crew size based on seasonal changes, tenant turnover, or evolving needs.

services.name: Day Porters
services.shortDescription: On-site daytime staff for continuous lobby, restroom, and common area upkeep during business hours.
services.longDescription: Between nightly cleans, your facility takes a beating ‚Äî restrooms run out of supplies, lobbies collect debris, and spills happen at the worst times. Day porters provide continuous, visible upkeep during operating hours. They restock restrooms, clean up spills, maintain lobby appearance, and handle break room turnover ‚Äî so your facility always looks like it was just cleaned, even at 4pm.

features.title: Restroom Monitoring
features.description: Scheduled restroom checks every 1‚Äì2 hours to restock paper products, refill soap dispensers, clean surfaces, and address odor issues in real-time.

features.title: Lobby & Reception Care
features.description: Continuous upkeep of entrance areas including glass cleaning, floor spot-mopping, trash emptying, and furniture straightening throughout the day.

features.title: Spill & Emergency Response
features.description: Immediate response to spills, messes, and unexpected cleaning needs during business hours ‚Äî no waiting until the night crew arrives.

features.title: Break Room & Kitchen Service
features.description: Counter wiping, dish clearing, appliance cleaning, and trash rotation in communal eating areas to maintain hygiene standards all day.

faqs.question: How many hours per day does a day porter work?
faqs.answer: It depends on your facility size and traffic. Most clients start with 4‚Äì6 hours during peak business hours. Your FSM will recommend the right coverage based on your foot traffic patterns.

faqs.question: Is the day porter an XIRI employee?
faqs.answer: Day porters are independent contractors vetted, insured, and managed through XIRI. We handle scheduling, quality control, and backup coverage if your regular porter is unavailable.

faqs.question: Can we combine day porter with nightly cleaning?
faqs.answer: Yes ‚Äî most clients do. Day porter handles daytime maintenance while a separate nightly crew performs the deep clean. Both are managed under your single XIRI invoice.

services.name: Disinfecting Services
services.shortDescription: EPA-registered electrostatic and surface disinfection to eliminate germs, viruses, and bacteria.
services.longDescription: Standard cleaning removes visible dirt. Disinfecting eliminates what you can't see ‚Äî influenza, norovirus, MRSA, and other pathogens that live on surfaces for hours or days. We deploy EPA-registered hospital-grade disinfectants through electrostatic sprayers and manual application, targeting high-touch surfaces and shared spaces. Whether it's a scheduled program or an emergency outbreak response, your facility is protected.

features.title: Electrostatic Spraying
features.description: 360-degree coverage using electrostatic sprayers that wrap disinfectant around surfaces, reaching areas manual wiping misses ‚Äî including chair undersides, keyboard backs, and vent grilles.

features.title: High-Touch Surface Protocol
features.description: Targeted manual disinfection of door handles, elevator buttons, shared equipment, light switches, and other high-touch vectors using EPA List N products.

features.title: Outbreak Emergency Response
features.description: Same-day or next-day full-facility disinfection when a confirmed illness is reported ‚Äî flu, COVID, norovirus, or other communicable diseases.

features.title: Scheduled Prevention Programs
features.description: Weekly or monthly disinfection programs that run alongside your normal cleaning to proactively reduce sick days and workplace transmission.

faqs.question: What disinfectants do you use?
faqs.answer: We exclusively use EPA-registered, hospital-grade disinfectants from the EPA's List N (effective against SARS-CoV-2) and List G (effective against norovirus). Product selection is matched to your facility type.

faqs.question: How quickly can you respond to an outbreak?
faqs.answer: We deploy same-day or next-day emergency disinfection. Your FSM coordinates the response, and our contractors arrive with electrostatic sprayers and full PPE within 24 hours of notification.

faqs.question: Is electrostatic spraying safe for electronics and sensitive equipment?
faqs.answer: Yes. The mist is ultra-fine and dries within minutes without residue. We cover or avoid sensitive electronics as needed, and our contractors are trained on proper application near medical and IT equipment.

services.name: Janitorial Services
services.shortDescription: Reliable nightly janitorial services ‚Äî vacuuming, trash removal, restroom cleaning, and surface care.
services.longDescription: Janitorial service is the backbone of facility maintenance ‚Äî and the most common source of complaints when done poorly. The difference between a forgettable cleaning company and XIRI is accountability. Your crew cleans every night, your Night Manager verifies every clean, and your FSM handles every issue before you need to make a phone call. No more chasing vendors, no more inconsistent results, no more surprise invoices.

features.title: Nightly Deep Clean
features.description: Complete vacuuming, mopping, trash removal, surface dusting, and restroom sanitization ‚Äî every night, following your custom scope document.

features.title: Restroom Sanitization
features.description: Full restroom cleaning including toilet and urinal disinfection, sink and mirror polishing, floor mopping, and restocking of all paper and soap supplies.

features.title: Kitchen & Break Room Care
features.description: Counter sanitization, appliance exterior cleaning, sink scrubbing, trash rotation, and floor maintenance for communal eating areas.

features.title: Night Manager Audits
features.description: Independent quality verification after every clean ‚Äî our Night Managers aren't the cleaners, they're the auditors. Photo documentation submitted nightly.

faqs.question: How is XIRI different from other janitorial companies?
faqs.answer: Most janitorial companies send a crew and hope for the best. We send a crew AND a Night Manager who independently audits their work. You get photographic proof of quality every morning, one invoice per month, and a dedicated FSM who handles everything.

faqs.question: What if my regular crew calls out sick?
faqs.answer: We maintain backup crews on every route. If your regular team can't make it, a qualified backup is dispatched the same night. You never miss a clean.

faqs.question: Can I get cleaning 7 nights a week?
faqs.answer: Yes. We offer 3, 5, or 7-night service options. Your FSM will recommend the right frequency based on your facility type, foot traffic, and budget.

services.name: Window Cleaning
services.shortDescription: Interior and exterior commercial window cleaning for storefronts, lobbies, and multi-story buildings.
services.longDescription: Dirty windows silently degrade your facility's curb appeal and interior lighting. Whether it's a medical office storefront, a car dealership showroom wall, or a multi-story office building, our window cleaning contractors deliver streak-free results using professional-grade equipment ‚Äî squeegees, water-fed poles, and lift access for upper floors. Scheduled monthly or quarterly to keep your glass sparkling year-round.

features.title: Storefront & Entrance Glass
features.description: Regular cleaning of customer-facing glass doors, sidelights, and windows to maintain a professional first impression.

features.title: Interior Partition Glass
features.description: Office partition glass, conference room walls, and lobby glass cleaned to eliminate fingerprints, smudges, and dust buildup.

features.title: Multi-Story Exterior
features.description: Water-fed pole systems and lift-accessed cleaning for second-floor and above exterior windows without scaffolding.

features.title: Frame & Track Detailing
features.description: Window frames, tracks, and sills cleaned and debris-free to prevent water damage and maintain operable windows.

faqs.question: How often should commercial windows be cleaned?
faqs.answer: Storefronts and customer-facing glass benefit from monthly service. Interior office glass and exterior upper-floor windows are typically scheduled quarterly. Your FSM recommends a frequency based on your location and traffic.

faqs.question: Can you clean windows on a multi-story building?
faqs.answer: Yes. We deploy water-fed pole systems for buildings up to 4 stories and coordinate lift access for taller buildings. All contractors carry proper insurance for elevated work.

faqs.question: Do you clean windows in winter?
faqs.answer: Yes, weather permitting. We use cold-weather solutions that prevent freezing and streaking. Service may be rescheduled during active precipitation but resumes as soon as conditions allow.

services.name: Pressure Washing
services.shortDescription: Commercial pressure washing for building exteriors, sidewalks, parking areas, and dumpster pads.
services.longDescription: Grime, mold, and oil stains on your building exterior, sidewalks, and parking areas send a clear message to clients: this business doesn't care about details. Pressure washing removes years of buildup in hours, restoring concrete, brick, and siding to near-original condition. We schedule it seasonally so your curb appeal never slips ‚Äî and it's all on your single monthly XIRI invoice.

features.title: Building Exterior Washing
features.description: Brick, stucco, siding, and EIFS cleaning to remove mold, algae, pollution staining, and cobwebs from your facility's exterior walls.

features.title: Sidewalk & Entrance Cleaning
features.description: High-pressure concrete cleaning to remove gum, stains, and grime from walkways, entry aprons, and ADA ramps.

features.title: Parking Area Degreasing
features.description: Oil spot treatment and full-surface pressure washing for parking lots, drive lanes, and service bay aprons.

features.title: Dumpster Pad Sanitization
features.description: Deep cleaning and deodorizing of dumpster enclosures and concrete pads to eliminate odors and pest attractants.

faqs.question: How often should a commercial building be pressure washed?
faqs.answer: Most facilities benefit from semi-annual pressure washing ‚Äî spring and fall. High-traffic areas like sidewalks and dumpster pads may need quarterly service. Your FSM schedules it automatically.

faqs.question: Will pressure washing damage our building materials?
faqs.answer: No. Our contractors adjust PSI and nozzle selection based on the surface material ‚Äî soft-wash for painted surfaces and EIFS, higher pressure for concrete and brick. We never use inappropriate pressure on delicate materials.

faqs.question: Can you pressure wash during business hours?
faqs.answer: Sidewalks and parking areas are typically done early morning or weekends. Building exteriors can be done during business hours as they don't affect interior operations.

services.name: Snow & Ice Removal
services.shortDescription: Commercial snow plowing, sidewalk clearing, and ice management to keep your facility safe and accessible.
services.longDescription: One slip-and-fall lawsuit costs more than a decade of snow removal service. We pair you with insured snow contractors who pre-treat, plow, and clear your lot and sidewalks according to your trigger depth ‚Äî 1 inch, 2 inches, or storm-based. Salt and calcium chloride application keeps walkways safe throughout the day. Your FSM monitors weather forecasts and dispatches crews proactively so you never wake up to an uncleared lot.

features.title: Trigger-Based Plowing
features.description: Automatic dispatch at your chosen snow depth trigger ‚Äî 1", 2", or 3" ‚Äî with continuous service during extended storms to maintain access.

features.title: Sidewalk & Entry Clearing
features.description: Hand-shoveling and snow blowing of all walkways, ADA ramps, emergency exits, and building entries to maintain safe pedestrian access.

features.title: Salt & Calcium Application
features.description: Pre-treatment before forecasted storms and post-storm application of rock salt or calcium chloride to prevent ice formation and refreeze.

features.title: Weather Monitoring
features.description: Your FSM monitors NWS forecasts and activates snow crews proactively ‚Äî you don't need to call, we're already on it.

faqs.question: What happens during an overnight storm?
faqs.answer: Our snow crews operate 24/7 during active storms. They plow continuously to maintain access, with a final pass and salt application before your business opens in the morning.

faqs.question: Do I need a separate snow removal contract?
faqs.answer: No. Snow and ice management is included in your XIRI service agreement. It appears on your same monthly invoice alongside janitorial and other services.

faqs.question: Are your snow contractors insured for slip-and-fall liability?
faqs.answer: Yes. All snow contractors carry commercial general liability insurance with snow and ice removal endorsements. We verify coverage annually and maintain certificates on file.

services.name: HVAC Maintenance
services.shortDescription: Scheduled HVAC filter replacement, vent cleaning, and preventive maintenance for commercial systems.
services.longDescription: Your HVAC system circulates air through every room in your facility ‚Äî and whatever is trapped in those filters goes with it. Clogged filters increase energy costs by up to 15%, accelerate equipment wear, and push dust, allergens, and pathogens into patient exam rooms and work areas. We schedule regular filter replacement, vent cleaning, and preventive maintenance checks so your system runs efficiently and your air stays clean.

features.title: Scheduled Filter Replacement
features.description: Monthly or quarterly filter swaps with proper MERV-rated filters for your system type ‚Äî tracked and documented by your FSM.

features.title: Vent & Diffuser Cleaning
features.description: Supply and return vent cleaning to remove dust buildup, improve airflow, and eliminate the dirty-vent appearance in patient and client areas.

features.title: Preventive Maintenance Checks
features.description: Quarterly system inspections including belt checks, condensate drain clearance, and thermostat calibration to prevent costly breakdowns.

features.title: Air Quality Documentation
features.description: Maintenance logs and filter change records for facilities requiring IAQ documentation for accreditation or tenant reporting.

faqs.question: How often should commercial HVAC filters be changed?
faqs.answer: Standard commercial filters should be changed every 30‚Äì90 days depending on system type, filter rating, and occupancy level. Medical facilities typically need monthly changes. Your FSM sets the schedule based on your specific system.

faqs.question: Can you service our rooftop units?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our HVAC contractors service rooftop package units, split systems, and mini-splits. They carry the required certifications and insurance for rooftop access and refrigerant handling.

faqs.question: Does HVAC maintenance really save money?
faqs.answer: Yes. A dirty filter forces your system to work harder, increasing energy consumption by 5‚Äì15%. Regular maintenance also extends equipment lifespan and prevents emergency repair calls that cost 3‚Äì5x more than preventive service.

services.name: Pest Control
services.shortDescription: Licensed commercial pest management for medical, childcare, food service, and general commercial facilities.
services.longDescription: A single pest sighting can destroy patient confidence, trigger a health department citation, or violate your lease terms. Our licensed pest control contractors provide integrated pest management (IPM) ‚Äî combining preventive measures, monitoring, and targeted treatment to eliminate infestations without overusing chemicals. For medical and childcare facilities, we use low-toxicity products that meet regulatory requirements while keeping your space pest-free.

features.title: Integrated Pest Management
features.description: A science-based approach that combines exclusion, sanitation recommendations, monitoring stations, and targeted treatment to prevent infestations before they start.

features.title: Monthly Monitoring & Treatment
features.description: Scheduled monthly visits for bait station checks, perimeter treatment, and inspection of vulnerable areas like break rooms, utility closets, and exterior entry points.

features.title: Medical-Safe Products
features.description: Low-toxicity, odor-free treatment options specifically selected for healthcare, childcare, and food service environments where chemical sensitivity is critical.

features.title: Emergency Response
features.description: Same-day or next-day emergency treatment for sudden infestations ‚Äî rodent sightings, ant invasions, or roach complaints handled before your next business day.

faqs.question: Are your pest control products safe for medical offices?
faqs.answer: Yes. We use EPA-registered, low-toxicity products specifically formulated for sensitive environments. Bait stations and gel applications are placed in concealed locations, never in patient-accessible areas.

faqs.question: How quickly can you respond to an emergency pest issue?
faqs.answer: Our pest control contractors provide same-day or next-day emergency response. Your FSM coordinates the call and ensures the issue is resolved before it affects your operations or patients.

faqs.question: Do you provide documentation for health inspections?
faqs.answer: Yes. We maintain digital pest management logs including treatment dates, products used, and inspection findings ‚Äî ready for DOH inspections or accreditation surveys.

services.name: Waste Management
services.shortDescription: Commercial and medical waste management including red-bag disposal, recycling, and dumpster coordination.
services.longDescription: Waste in a commercial facility isn't just trash ‚Äî it's a compliance liability. Medical offices generate regulated biohazard waste that requires certified handling. All facilities need proper recycling separation to meet local ordinances. And if your dumpster service is unreliable, overflow becomes a pest and odor problem fast. We coordinate waste hauling, red-bag pickup, recycling compliance, and dumpster scheduling under one managed service.

features.title: Medical Waste Handling
features.description: Certified red-bag waste pickup, sharps container exchange, and manifesting in full compliance with OSHA's Bloodborne Pathogen Standard and DOT shipping regulations.

features.title: Recycling Program Management
features.description: Proper recycling stream separation, container placement, and hauler coordination to meet local recycling ordinances and reduce waste costs.

features.title: Dumpster & Compactor Service
features.description: Scheduling, sizing, and vendor coordination for dumpster service ‚Äî ensuring you never have overflow issues or missed pickups.

features.title: Compliance Documentation
features.description: Waste manifests, hauling receipts, and disposal certificates maintained digitally for regulatory inspections and accreditation surveys.

faqs.question: Do you handle biohazard waste for medical offices?
faqs.answer: Yes. We coordinate certified medical waste haulers who provide red-bag pickup, sharps container exchange, and pharmaceutical waste disposal in full compliance with OSHA and state regulations.

faqs.question: Can you help us reduce waste disposal costs?
faqs.answer: Yes. Your FSM audits your current waste stream and often identifies opportunities to right-size dumpster service, improve recycling separation, and reduce overall hauling frequency ‚Äî saving 10‚Äì20% on waste costs.

faqs.question: How do you handle waste documentation for accreditation?
faqs.answer: We maintain digital waste manifests, BOL copies, and disposal certificates. Your FSM can pull a compliance report for any date range within minutes for JCAHO, OSHA, or state health department surveys.

services.name: Parking Lot Maintenance
services.shortDescription: Parking lot sweeping, striping, pothole repair, and lighting maintenance for commercial properties.
services.longDescription: Your parking lot is the first and last thing every visitor sees. Faded striping, debris-filled corners, burned-out lights, and potholes communicate neglect before anyone walks through the door. We coordinate regular sweeping, line striping, crack sealing, and light maintenance so your parking area stays safe, ADA-compliant, and presentation-ready ‚Äî all under your single XIRI service agreement.

features.title: Power Sweeping
features.description: Mechanical sweeping of parking surfaces to remove debris, sand, leaves, and litter ‚Äî scheduled weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly based on traffic.

features.title: Line Striping & ADA Compliance
features.description: Fresh paint for parking stalls, fire lanes, directional arrows, and ADA-accessible spaces to maintain compliance and professional appearance.

features.title: Crack Sealing & Pothole Repair
features.description: Preventive crack filling and pothole patching to extend pavement life and prevent trip-and-fall liability on your property.

features.title: Parking Lot Lighting
features.description: Bulb replacement, fixture repair, and timer adjustment for parking lot and building-perimeter lighting to maintain safety and security.

faqs.question: How often should a commercial parking lot be swept?
faqs.answer: High-traffic medical and retail lots benefit from weekly sweeping. Lower-traffic office lots can run bi-weekly or monthly. Your FSM sets the schedule based on debris accumulation and local ordinance requirements.

faqs.question: When should parking lot lines be repainted?
faqs.answer: Typically every 18‚Äì24 months, depending on traffic and weather exposure. ADA spaces and fire lanes should be evaluated annually. Your FSM flags fading lines during site visits.

faqs.question: Do you handle parking lot lighting repairs?
faqs.answer: Yes. We coordinate bulb replacement, ballast repair, and photocell adjustment for parking lot pole lights and building-mounted fixtures. All electrical work is performed by licensed contractors.

services.name: Handyman Services
services.shortDescription: On-demand commercial handyman for repairs, installations, and minor maintenance projects.
services.longDescription: A broken towel dispenser, a sticking door, a leaking faucet ‚Äî these small issues pile up fast when you don't have a maintenance person on staff. Our handyman contractors handle the miscellaneous repairs and installations that don't warrant a specialized trade contractor. Drywall patching, fixture installs, door adjustments, caulking, and more ‚Äî all requested through your FSM and billed on your single monthly invoice.

features.title: General Repairs
features.description: Drywall patching, paint touch-ups, caulking, grout repair, and other cosmetic fixes to maintain your facility's professional appearance.

features.title: Fixture & Hardware Installation
features.description: Mounting shelves, installing soap dispensers, replacing towel holders, hanging signage, and other fixture work that doesn't require a licensed trade.

features.title: Door & Lock Maintenance
features.description: Door closer adjustment, hinge replacement, weatherstripping, and lockset repair to keep entries secure and ADA-compliant.

features.title: Plumbing & Electrical Minor Work
features.description: Faucet washer replacement, toilet handle repair, light switch swaps, and outlet cover replacement ‚Äî items too small for a trade call but too important to ignore.

faqs.question: What's the difference between handyman and a licensed contractor?
faqs.answer: Handyman services cover general repairs and installations that don't require a trade license ‚Äî drywall, fixtures, doors, minor plumbing. For licensed work like electrical panel changes or plumbing rough-ins, we coordinate a licensed trade specialist.

faqs.question: How do I request handyman work?
faqs.answer: Just tell your FSM. They create a work order, dispatch a handyman, and confirm completion ‚Äî all within your existing service agreement. No separate quotes or invoices.

faqs.question: Can your handyman work during business hours?
faqs.answer: Yes. Most handyman tasks are quiet enough to perform during operating hours. Your FSM coordinates scheduling to minimize disruption to your staff and patients or clients.

services.name: Post-Construction Cleanup
services.shortDescription: Multi-phase construction cleanup: rough clean, final clean, and move-in ready detailing.
services.longDescription: After a buildout, renovation, or tenant improvement project, construction dust and debris penetrate every surface ‚Äî HVAC ducts, window tracks, behind fixtures, inside cabinets. Standard cleaning won't cut it. Our post-construction crews perform multi-phase cleanup: rough clean to remove bulk debris, detail clean to address dust and residue on every surface, and a final punch-list walkthrough to ensure move-in readiness. Get your space open faster without pulling your regular cleaning crew off their routes.

features.title: Rough Clean (Phase 1)
features.description: Removal of bulk construction debris, scrap materials, and dust accumulation. Sweep and vacuum all surfaces, remove protective coverings and tape residue.

features.title: Detail Clean (Phase 2)
features.description: Surface-by-surface dust removal including cabinetry interiors, window tracks, light fixtures, vent covers, and all horizontal and vertical surfaces.

features.title: Glass & Window Cleaning
features.description: Removal of construction film, paint overspray, label adhesive, and dust from all glass surfaces including interior partitions.

features.title: Final Punch-List Walkthrough
features.description: Project manager walkthrough with your contractor or property manager to identify and address any remaining issues before occupancy.

faqs.question: How long does post-construction cleanup take?
faqs.answer: It depends on the project size. A single medical suite buildout typically takes 1‚Äì2 days for detail cleaning. Larger projects may take 3‚Äì5 days. We provide a time estimate after an on-site assessment.

faqs.question: Can you clean immediately after construction finishes?
faqs.answer: Yes. We can deploy crews within 24‚Äì48 hours of project completion. Your FSM coordinates directly with your general contractor to schedule the cleanup phases.

faqs.question: Do you handle HVAC duct cleaning after construction?
faqs.answer: Yes. Construction dust in ductwork is a major indoor air quality issue. We coordinate duct cleaning specialists as part of the post-construction scope to ensure your HVAC system is debris-free before occupancy.

locations.name: Great Neck, NY
locations.localInsight: Home to the Northern Blvd Medical Mile ‚Äî one of Long Island's densest concentrations of private medical practices, urgent care centers, and specialty clinics. Great Neck's affluent community demands exceptional facility presentation.
locations.complianceNote: Nassau County enforces strict hazardous waste storage regulations (Local Law 12-2019) that affect medical waste handling in private practices. Our FSMs ensure your facility stays compliant.
locations.serviceChallenges: High foot traffic in Great Neck Plaza and Northern Blvd storefronts requires more frequent day porter services during business hours. Multi-tenant medical buildings need coordinated after-hours cleaning schedules.
locations.whyXiri: We already operate along the Northern Blvd corridor, which means faster response times and route-dense service for your facility. Our Night Managers verify every clean within the Great Neck service zone.

localFaqs.question: Do you service medical offices near Northwell Health on Northern Blvd?
localFaqs.answer: Yes. We actively serve facilities along the entire Northern Blvd Medical Mile corridor, from Great Neck Plaza to the Northwell Health campus. Our teams are already in the area nightly.

localFaqs.question: Can you handle multi-tenant medical building cleaning in Great Neck?
localFaqs.answer: Absolutely. We coordinate after-hours schedules across multiple suites in the same building, ensuring minimal disruption to the shared hallways and each individual practice gets their dedicated clean.

localFaqs.question: How do you handle the Nassau County medical waste regulations?
localFaqs.answer: Our FSMs are trained on Nassau County's Local Law 12-2019 hazardous waste storage requirements. We ensure proper containerization, labeling, and manifesting for all red-bag waste.

locations.name: New Hyde Park, NY

locations.localInsight: Anchored by Long Island Jewish Medical Center (LIJ) and the Lake Success business park, New Hyde Park is a hub for medical professionals, specialty clinics, and ambulatory surgery centers serving the western Nassau corridor.
locations.complianceNote: Facilities near LIJ must meet heightened infection control standards due to proximity to a major hospital campus. Our terminal cleaning protocols align with JCAHO and CMS guidelines.
locations.serviceChallenges: Many New Hyde Park medical offices operate extended hours (7am‚Äì9pm) to serve the LIJ referral network. Our cleaning schedules flex around these demanding hours with late-night and early-morning options.
locations.whyXiri: Our route density in the LIJ corridor means we're already servicing nearby facilities every night. Adding your location to our route is seamless ‚Äî no windshield time wasted, just reliable service.

localFaqs.question: Do you service medical practices near LIJ Medical Center?
localFaqs.answer: Yes. We serve multiple facilities within the LIJ corridor, including practices on Lakeville Rd and Marcus Ave. Our Night Managers verify every clean in this zone.

localFaqs.question: Can you handle surgery center terminal cleaning in New Hyde Park?
localFaqs.answer: Yes. We follow AORN-standard terminal cleaning protocols specifically designed for ambulatory surgery centers. Our contractors are trained in OR-grade disinfection and ATP testing verification.

localFaqs.question: What about facilities with extended operating hours?
localFaqs.answer: We work around your schedule. Many New Hyde Park practices run until 9pm ‚Äî our teams arrive after close and complete their work before your first patient arrives the next morning.
